content.text: Calculate the area of a shaded triangle based on the following steps: $\sqrt{64} = 8$ cm. Area of $\triangle CED = \frac{1}{2} \times 8 \times 20 = 80$ cm$^2$. Area of $\triangle BED = 32$ cm$^2$. Shaded $\triangle = 80 - 32 = 48$ cm$^2$. (A diagram showing triangles CED and BED is implied but not provided on this page).
